com.st.st25sdk.command

Class Type3Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.command.Type3Command
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Type3CommandInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NdefType3Command

    public class Type3Command
extends java.lang.Object
implements Type3CommandInterface
    Defines methods to build all the NFC Forum Type3 commands

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int T3T_DEFAULT_NBR_OF_BYTES_PER_BLOCK
      Number of bytes per block
      protected RFReaderInterface.TransceiveMode transceiveMode

      TYPE3 check/read request command code
      static byte TYPE3_CHECK_RESPONSE_CODE
      TYPE3 check/read response code
      static int TYPE3_CHECK_RESPONSE_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH
      Size of the header frame in Check response (Code(1B) + NFCID2(8B) + Flags(2B) + Number of Blocks(1B))
      static byte TYPE3_SENSF_REQUEST_CMD
      TYPE3 sensF_req/polling request command code
      static byte TYPE3_SENSF_RESPONSE_CODE
      TYPE3 sensF_req/polling response code

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] check(byte[] nfcId2, int[] serviceCodeList, int[] blockList)
      CHECK request as defined by NFC Forum Type3 tags
      protected void checkIso18092Type3Response(byte[] response)
      This function checks a command response and raises a STException in case of error Check that response length is greater than 11 bytes to be able to check Flag1 and Flag 2
      byte[] checkType3TagPresence()
      Check the presence of Type3 tag as defined by NFC Forum Type3 tag specification
      protected void generateCmdException(byte[] response) 
      int getBlockSize()
      This function returns the number of byte in a block
      byte[] readBlock(byte[] nfcId2, int blockNumber)
      Read command, used to read data from Type3 Tag Type3 check command sends back : CMD code (1B) + NFCID2 (8B) + FLAGs (2B) + NbOfBlocks (1B)+ read data(16B))
      byte[] readBlocks(byte[] nfcId2, int firstBlockAddress, int sizeInBlocks)
      High level blocks read function for Type3 tags This function allows to read several blocks
      byte[] readBytes(byte[] nfcId2, int byteAddress, int sizeInBytes)
      High level bytes read function for Type3 tags This function allows to read one or more bytes even if they are not in the same block
      byte[] sensF(byte[] systemCode, byte requestCode, byte timeSlotNumber)
      SENS_REQ request as defined by NFC Forum Digital Protocol specification
      byte[] transceive(java.lang.String commandName, byte[] frame)
      Method used to send RF frame to the tag and receive RF response from the tag through RF reader interface
      byte[] update(byte[] nfcId2, int[] serviceCodeList, int[] blockList, byte[] blockData)
      UPDATE request as defined by NFC Forum Type3 tags
      byte[] writeBlock(byte[] nfcId2, int blockNumber, byte[] data)
      Write command, used to read data from Type3 Tag Type3 update send back status flags 1 and 2
      void writeBlocks(byte[] nfcId2, int firstBlockAddress, byte[] data)
      High level blocks write function for Type3 tags This function allows to write several blocks
      void writeBytes(byte[] nfcId2, int byteAddress, byte[] data)
      High level byte write function for Type3 tags This function allows to write one or more bytes inside blocks even if they are not in the same block The function reads the blocks to be modified, changes the bytes to be written then writes back the blocks onto the tag

      • readBlock

        public byte[] readBlock(byte[] nfcId2,
                        int blockNumber)
                 throws STException
        Read command, used to read data from Type3 Tag Type3 check command sends back : CMD code (1B) + NFCID2 (8B) + FLAGs (2B) + NbOfBlocks (1B)+ read data(16B))
        Parameters:
        nfcId2 - tag's manufacturer Id
        blockNumber - address of the block to read (16 bytes)
        Returns:
        16-byte read data
        Throws:
        STException

      • readBlocks

                         int firstBlockAddress,
                         int sizeInBlocks)
                  throws STException

        Parameters:

        firstBlockAddress - Address of the first block to read
        sizeInBlocks - Number of blocks to read

        read blocks

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(byte[] nfcId2,
                       int byteAddress,
                       byte[] data)
                throws STException
        High level byte write function for Type3 tags This function allows to write one or more bytes inside blocks even if they are not in the same block The function reads the blocks to be modified, changes the bytes to be written then writes back the blocks onto the tag
        Parameters:
        nfcId2 - tag's manufacturer Id
        byteAddress - Address of the first byte to be updated
        data - Data to be update
        Throws:
        STException

                  throws STException

        Parameters:
        commandName - Name of command passed to the transceive implementation
        frame - RF frame to be sent with transceive method
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException
